resources.string:
Where is Io lets you know where the 4 galliean satellites of Jupiter are at any given time. Even through only 8x binoculars you can make out these 4 moons on nights when Jupiter is up.
The portrait view shows a 4 day window of time, with the orange line representing the current state. In landscape view, you get a close up on the first portion of the graph (total time will vary based on the aspect ratio of your device). Jupiter's size is slightly exagerated (2x) for aesthetics.
This is a work in progress, expect to see additional functions rolled out over time.
Copyright (c) 2010 - Sean Dague (http://dague.net)
This software includes simulation code derived from Johannes Gajdosik\'s vsop87, elp82b, and l1 model implementations. Much thanks to his excellent work in porting Fortran models to C and making those available for general use.

\ Radius: 11.209 Earths
\ Mass: 317.8 Earths
 
 Jupiter is the 5th planet from the Sun, and the largest in our solar system.
 
\ More info at: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jupiter
